meta-model.name: All-In-One CMCC Chemistry Model
meta-model.description: A schema extending the PhysicsTOE with atoms, molecules, bonds, reactions, etc.

meta.title: CMCC Complete Chemistry ToE Meta-Model
meta.subtitle: A Declarative Structural Approach to Chemical Entities and Reactions
meta.abstract: This Chemistry extension broadens the CMCC (Conceptual Model Completeness Conjecture) approach to cover atomic, molecular, and reaction-level concepts. Building on the existing ACID-based schema that unifies math and physics, this domain model encodes all chemical structures—like atoms, bonds, molecules, solutions, and reactions—via five fundamental primitives (S, D, L, A, F). The resulting framework allows cross-domain reasoning (such as quantum-level wavefunctions or reaction kinetics) in a unified, syntax-free data structure.

key_points: Introduces detailed entities for atoms, bonds, molecules, and reactions within the broader CMCC environment.
Showcases how aggregator rollups and lambda formulas handle chemical logic (e.g., stoichiometry, bond polarity, reaction energetics).
Demonstrates a purely declarative approach, enabling Turing-completeness without writing domain-specific code.
Integrates seamlessly with the CMCC Physics model for quantum wavefunctions and multiway branching, bridging quantum to classical chemistry.
implications: Enables cross-domain queries (e.g., quantum wavefunctions plus reaction stoichiometry) using a single cohesive schema.
Reduces translation overhead between domain-specific tools, offering a universal repository for chemical knowledge.
Lays groundwork for expansions into biology or materials science by extending the same structural paradigm.

narrative.title: CMCC Chemistry Extension
content: Chemistry often requires bridging multiple scales: quantum mechanical interactions, molecular geometry, reaction kinetics, and thermodynamics. In a standard approach, each scale might be handled by separate tools and data formats, leading to fragmentation and repeated redefinition of core concepts.

By contrast, the CMCC Chemistry Model encodes these layers in a single, self-describing set of tables, references, and formulas—every concept is data-driven. 'Atoms' link to fundamental 'Particle' definitions, 'Molecules' aggregate atoms (and optionally wavefunctions), while 'Reactions' track stoichiometry, thermodynamic estimates, and kinetic data. The system handles partial or complete references to quantum states for advanced calculations, but remains fully consistent with the overarching ACID-based design that anchors the entire CMCC framework.

Whether you're investigating ring strain, measuring reaction feasibility, or bridging into the biology domain, the same five fundamental primitives apply—Schema, Data, Lookups, Aggregations, and Lambda fields—ensuring minimal friction in cross-domain expansions and maximum clarity in capturing complex chemical phenomena.

entities.name: Atom
entities.description: Represents a single element or ion, referencing the underlying physics Particle optionally.

fields.name: mass_override
fields.note: If present, use this mass instead of Particle.mass, e.g. for isotopes

fields.name: underlying_particle_id
fields.note: Optional link to the physics-level Particle if we want to unify mass, spin, etc.

aggregations.name: effective_mass
aggregations.formula: IF mass_override != null THEN mass_override ELSE (LOOKUP(underlying_particle_id).mass)

aggregations.name: valence_electron_count
aggregations.description: Approximate valence electron count by atomic number and charge.

aggregations.name: electronegativity_estimate
aggregations.description: Estimated electronegativity (Pauling-like scale).

aggregations.name: radius_estimate
aggregations.description: Rough covalent radius or van der Waals radius in pm.

aggregations.name: ionization_energy_estimate
aggregations.description: First-ionization energy approximation.

aggregations.name: electron_affinity_estimate
aggregations.description: Approximate electron affinity for the atom.

aggregations.name: predicted_isotope_distribution
aggregations.description: Returns approximate isotope ratios for this element.

aggregations.name: orbital_configuration_string
aggregations.description: Generates a string describing electron configuration, e.g. '1s2 2s2 ...'.

aggregations.name: predicted_atomic_density
aggregations.description: A naive aggregator for density (g/cm³) in the bulk elemental form.

aggregations.name: nuclear_binding_energy_estimate
aggregations.description: Rough nuclear binding energy from mass defect.

constraints.name: integer_atom_number
constraints.error_message: Atomic number must be positive integer

constraints.name: valid_charge_state
constraints.error_message: Cannot have more electrons than Z+some large number, toy rule

entities.name: Bond
entities.description: Represents a chemical bond between two atoms (intra-molecular or otherwise).

fields.name: bond_type
fields.note: e.g. single, double, triple, ionic, etc.

aggregations.name: bond_polarity_index
aggregations.description: Rough measure of bond polarity from electronegativity difference.

aggregations.name: bond_length_estimate
aggregations.description: Estimates bond length in Å or pm.

aggregations.name: bond_dissociation_energy_estimate
aggregations.description: A rough BDE estimate, e.g. single vs double bond, polar vs nonpolar.

aggregations.name: is_resonance_bond
aggregations.description: Flags if this bond might be part of a resonance system.

aggregations.name: bond_angle_with_third_atom
aggregations.description: Predicts angle (in degrees) formed with a third reference atom (toy geometry approach).

aggregations.name: bond_vibrational_frequency
aggregations.description: Approx IR vibrational frequency (cm^-1) using reduced mass and bond order.

aggregations.name: bond_rotational_barrier
aggregations.description: Estimates torsional barrier for single bonds or partial for double.

aggregations.name: bond_reactivity_score
aggregations.description: Scores how likely the bond is to break or rearrange under common reactions.

aggregations.name: estimated_bond_angle_strain
aggregations.description: Flags strain if part of a ring or unusual geometry, referencing ring size or known angle deviance.

constraints.name: bond_order_valid
constraints.error_message: Toy constraint: bond_order must be between 0 and 3

entities.name: Molecule
entities.description: Collection of atoms connected by bonds, plus optional reference to quantum wavefunction.

fields.name: wavefunction_id
fields.note: If we have a quantum wavefunction at the molecular level

lookups.name: bonds
lookups.join_condition: Bond.atom_id_1 IN atoms OR Bond.atom_id_2 IN atoms

aggregations.name: total_valence_electrons
aggregations.description: Sum of valence electrons from all constituent atoms.

aggregations.name: is_organic
aggregations.formula: IF( COUNT( atoms where element_symbol='C' ) > 0, true, false )
aggregations.description: Simple check for presence of carbon to label molecule as organic.

aggregations.name: predicted_solubility_in_water
aggregations.description: Rough guess of water solubility from polar groups and net charge.

aggregations.name: formal_charge_distribution
aggregations.description: Array or mapping of formal charges for each atom.

aggregations.name: heavy_atom_count
aggregations.description: Number of atoms heavier than hydrogen.

aggregations.name: estimated_boiling_point
aggregations.description: Naive or ML-based boiling point predictor.

aggregations.name: predicted_HOMO_energy
aggregations.description: Estimated HOMO energy from partial quantum or empirical approach.

aggregations.name: predicted_LUMO_energy
aggregations.description: Estimated LUMO energy from partial quantum or empirical approach.

aggregations.name: HOMO_LUMO_gap
aggregations.description: Difference between the predicted LUMO and HOMO energies.

aggregations.name: approximate_pKa
aggregations.description: Naive aggregator for acid dissociation constant based on functional groups.

aggregations.name: predicted_UV_Vis_absorbance
aggregations.description: Rough guess of UV-Vis absorbance max in nm.

aggregations.name: ro5_violation_count
aggregations.description: Counts how many Lipinski Rule of 5 criteria are violated.

lambdas.name: possible_tautomers
lambdas.description: Returns a set of potential tautomeric forms for the molecule.

constraints.name: bond_connectivity_check
constraints.error_message: All atoms in a molecule must be connected via bonds

entities.name: MoleculeAtomMapping
entities.description: Bridging table for many-to-many: which atoms belong to which molecule and in what count (for coarse stoichiometric models).

aggregations.name: fraction_in_molecule
aggregations.description: Fraction of total atom count for this species in the molecule.

aggregations.name: mass_fraction_in_molecule
aggregations.description: Fraction of total molecular mass contributed by this atom type.

entities.name: Reaction
entities.description: A chemical reaction with references to reactants, products, and optional details.

aggregations.name: alias_R
aggregations.note: Universal gas constant (toy). If not in your physics constants, you can store it there or do partial reference.

aggregations.name: reaction_exothermicity_estimate
aggregations.description: Crude enthalpy difference to gauge exo vs endo.

aggregations.name: reaction_order_estimate
aggregations.description: Counts sum of stoichiometric exponents as naive overall order.

aggregations.name: reaction_rate_constant_estimate
aggregations.description: A direct aggregator for rate constant using Arrhenius-like logic.

aggregations.name: equilibrium_constant_estimate
aggregations.description: Rough K_eq from enthalpy/entropy or guess.

aggregations.name: reaction_feasibility_score
aggregations.description: Generates an integer or float rating: 0=not feasible, 1=partially feasible, etc.

aggregations.name: approximate_gibbs_free_energy
aggregations.description: Rough ∆G estimate from enthalpy difference and guessed entropy term.

aggregations.name: predicted_equilibrium_conversion
aggregations.description: Guesses reaction's extent at equilibrium using a toy model.

aggregations.name: reaction_mechanism_classification
aggregations.description: Labels reaction as SN2, radical, elimination, etc., in a simplified manner.

aggregations.name: catalysis_susceptibility
aggregations.description: Rates how easily a catalyst can lower the barrier, from 0=low to 1=high.

constraints.name: mass_conservation
constraints.error_message: Mass must be conserved (toy constraint ignoring binding energy).

entities.name: ReactionParticipant
entities.description: Bridging entity for Reaction, specifying which Molecule is a reactant or product.

aggregations.name: quantity_needed
aggregations.description: Compute how many moles or grams are required given stoichiometry.

aggregations.name: limiting_reagent_check
aggregations.description: Flags if this reactant is limiting based on available amounts.

aggregations.name: stoichiometric_excess
aggregations.description: Checks how much of this participant is over the stoichiometric need, referencing what's 'on-hand'.

aggregations.name: partial_pressure_contribution
aggregations.description: Estimates partial pressure if gas-phase and partial pressures are tracked.

aggregations.name: per_atom_contribution
aggregations.description: Fraction of total reaction atoms contributed by this participant.

entities.name: Solution
entities.description: A new entity for solutions or mixtures containing one or more solutes and a solvent.

fields.name: solvent_molecule_id
fields.description: The primary solvent used in this solution.

fields.name: volume_liters
fields.description: Volume of the solution in liters.

aggregations.name: total_solute_concentration
aggregations.description: Sum of all solute concentrations in the solution.

aggregations.name: solution_ionic_strength
aggregations.description: Half the sum of c_i * z_i^2 for each ionic species i in the solution.

aggregations.name: freezing_point_depression_estimate
aggregations.description: Predicts ∆Tf from a simplistic colligative property formula.

entities.name: SolutionSoluteMapping
entities.description: Bridging entity to link solutions with solute molecules, storing concentration or amount data.

fields.name: concentration_of_solute
fields.description: Concentration of a particular solute in mol/L or another consistent unit.
